Package pl.polsl.lab.bartosz.sosnica.sudoku.model

Class BoardModel

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab.bartosz.sosnica.sudoku.model.BoardModel
public class BoardModel extends Object
Version:
1.0 The BoardModel class represents the model of the Sudoku board. It handles board setup, placement of values, validation of moves, and difficulty level management.
Author:
Bartosz So≈õnica

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardModel

      public BoardModel()
      Constructor for BoardModel. Initializes the board by calling the settingUpBoard method.

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public String[][] getBoard()
      Returns the current state of the board.
      Returns:
      the 2D array representing the board.

    • settingUpBoard

      public void settingUpBoard()
      Initializes the board with empty cells represented by "[ ]".

    • placeValue

      public void placeValue(int row, int col, int value)
      Places a value at the specified row and column on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index where the value should be placed.
      col - the column index where the value should be placed.
      value - the value to place on the board.

    • removeValue

      public void removeValue(int row, int col)
      Removes a value from the specified row and column on the board, setting it to "[ ]".
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.

    • isValidNumber

      public void isValidNumber(int row, int col, int value) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Checks if the specified value to be placed is valid based on the Sudoku rules.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the move.
      col - the column index of the move.
      value - the value to place.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the move is invalid (e.g., coordinates or value out of bounds).

    • isValidPosition

      public void isValidPosition(int row, int col, int value) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Validates if the specified value can be placed at the given row and column, ensuring that the value does not already exist in the same row or column.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      value - the value to place.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the value is already present in the row or column.

    • isValueIn3x3

      public void isValueIn3x3(int row, int col, int value) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Validates if the specified value already exists in the 3x3 subgrid containing the given row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      value - the value to check.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the value is already present in the 3x3 subgrid.

    • checkDifficultyInput

      public void checkDifficultyInput(String[] diffLevel) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Checks if the input for the difficulty level is valid.
      Parameters:
      diffLevel - the user's input for difficulty level as a string array.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the difficulty input is invalid (e.g., too few arguments).

    • isDiffLvlNumber

      public void isDiffLvlNumber(String diffLevel) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Validates if the input string for the difficulty level can be parsed as a number.
      Parameters:
      diffLevel - the difficulty level as a string.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the difficulty level is not a number.

    • isDiffLvlCorrect

      public void isDiffLvlCorrect(String diffLevel) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Validates if the parsed difficulty level is within the allowed range (1-40).
      Parameters:
      diffLevel - the difficulty level as a string.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the difficulty level is outside the valid range.

    • getDifficultyLevel

      public int getDifficultyLevel()
      Returns the current difficulty level of the Sudoku game.
      Returns:
      the difficulty level as an integer.

    • settingDifficultyLevel

      public void settingDifficultyLevel(String diffLevel)
      Sets the difficulty level of the Sudoku game based on the provided string.
      Parameters:
      diffLevel - the difficulty level as a string, which is parsed into an integer.
